title: Haikyuu Touch the Dream Tier List
description: Discover the top styles in 'Volleyball Legends' (formerly 'Haikyuu Legends') with our comprehensive tier list. Learn about each style's strengths and how they can enhance your gameplay.
heading: Haikyuu Touch the Dream Tier List
introText: Discover the top styles in 'Volleyball Legends' (formerly 'Haikyuu Legends') with our comprehensive tier list. Learn about each style's strengths and how they can enhance your gameplay.

data.itemDescription: Bokuto boasts complete block, jump, and spike stats, along with high bump and serve abilities, making them ideal for both smashers and defensive plays
Kageyomo excels with a complete set of stats, boasting high block, jump, dive, speed, and serve abilities
Oigawa possesses complete jump and serve stats, along with very high block and set capabilities, making them suitable for defensive and setting players
Sanu offers complete block and spike stats, along with high ratings in jump, dive, set, and bump. However, it has a very low speed stat
Kuzee possesses a complete jump stat and excels with very high bump, serve, spike, and block abilities; however, their speed is notably low
Nichonayo features complete bump and dive stats for strong defense, coupled with good speed and decent jump attributes; however, their serve attribute is poor
Yabu possesses complete jump and speed stats, along with high block, bump, and dive abilities; however, their serve stat is poor
Yomomute possesses a complete bump stat and high dive and spike attributes
Sagafura possesses complete speed and bump stats, along with high dive and set capabilities; however, they have poor serve and spike scenarios
Uchishima possesses complete jump and spike stats, along with very high block and dive numbers; however, their bump ability is low
Kosumi boasts complete bump and dive stats, along with high jump and set stats; however, their serve is notably poor
Tsukishima possesses an extremely good jump stat, good block and setting stats, but is extremely slow
Azamena has good jump, serve, and spike abilities, but poor set stats
Iwaezeni features high jump and spike attributes, decent block, speed, and set capabilities, but is bad at diving and bumping the ball
Ojiri possesses good bump, jump, and serve stats but has low setting and spike numbers
Kito features high bump, dive, and speed stats; however, their setting and serving stats are poor
Hinoto maintains equally balanced stats across all departments, yet the style lacks any standout features
Yamegushi exhibits high jump, bump, and serve stats, along with decent dive capabilities on defense; nonetheless, they perform poorly in spiking and setting scenarios
